etymologies: late 18th century: from South African Dutch, from Dutch hert ‘hart’ + beest ‘beast’

definitions: a large African antelope with a long head and sloping back, related to the gnus.

notes.text: Genera Alcelaphus, Damaliscus, and Sigmoceros, family Bovidae: three or four species, in particular the red hartebeest (A. buselaphus), which typically has a reddish-brown coat

shortDefinitions: large African antelope with long head and sloping back
